meanings.definition: To give out or deliver something to a number of people.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will distribute the worksheets to all the students in the class.
meanings.sent2: She distributes candies to the children on Halloween.
meanings.sent3: The magician will distribute smiles to the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The wind will distribute the seeds across the field, like nature's own gardener.
meanings.sent5: The postman will distribute joy with the delivery of the long-awaited package.

meanings.definition: To divide something among several or many.
meanings.sent1: Let's distribute the cake evenly among all the guests at the party.
meanings.sent2: The company will distribute the profits among its shareholders.
meanings.sent3: The siblings will distribute the chores fairly to avoid arguments.
meanings.sent4: Time will distribute its moments unequally, some passing quickly, others lingering.
meanings.sent5: The chef will distribute the spices carefully to create a perfectly balanced dish.

meanings.definition: To spread or scatter something over an area.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will distribute seeds across the field for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: The artist will distribute colors on the canvas to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child will distribute toys all over the room in a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: The stars will distribute their light across the night sky, twinkling like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The chef will distribute the herbs evenly over the dish for a burst of flavor in every bite.
